summary: This bill, the "Medicare for All Act," establishes a national health insurance program providing comprehensive healthcare coverage to all U.S. residents. It outlines benefits including hospital services, prescription drugs, mental health, and long-term care, eliminating cost-sharing. The bill sets provider participation standards, whistleblower protections, and establishes a Universal Medicare Trust Fund. It makes conforming amendments to ERISA, terminates existing federal health programs (Medicare, Medicaid, etc.) and programs related to pay for performance, and sets transitional provisions with a Medicare transition buy-in option. Provisions address health equity, primary care access, and prescription drug price negotiations.
